name: Phone or fax number is not in international format (ITU-T E.164) - Switzerland (Aargau)
description: This challenge addresses problems caused by phone and fax numbers not in international format (ITU-T E.164).
instruction:
All phone and fax numbers should be in international format (ITU-T E.164) (http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:phone). E.164 defines a general format for international telephone numbers and ensures that the numbers can be called from almost any phone. Numbers in different formats cause a lot of problems, especially when there is no country or area code.

Some countries have numbers that can only be called from a local phone or from a phone network within the country. Those numbers should be mapped with the corresponsing country code (e.g.: phone:FR=0 800 123 456).

Mapping objects with universal emergency numbers (e.g. 911 / 110 / 112) for local objects is also a problem since this could result in non emergency calls blocking real emergency calls when people try to reach a local police station, hospital or fire station with non emergency matters.
statusMessage:
Too Many Requests: OSM3S Response

The data included in this document is from www.openstreetmap.org. The data is made available under ODbL.
